revised_title: Anisotropy of Deformation Twinning in Iron-Nickel Martensite Crystals
tldr: The authors studied the deformation twinning behavior of iron-nickel martensite crystals with transformation twin microstructures. They used the Kossel microdiffraction technique to determine the orientation of martensite crystals and found that twinning occurs mainly on {112} planes. The presence of transformation twins and slip bands influences the predominance of deformation modes in these crystals.
